summary: I was at work yesterday in the toys department where they sell Magic 8 balls, and I asked it," Will [redacted] be resurrected...
body:
I was at work yesterday in the toys department where they sell Magic 8 balls, and I asked it,“ Will [redacted] be resurrected later?” and it said ‘outlook not so good.’

I think I scared off a kid with the stink eye I gave the ball.

reblog.comment:
I was at work yesterday in the toys department where they sell Magic 8 balls, and I asked it,“ Will [redacted] be resurrected later?” and it said ‘outlook not so good.’

I think I scared off a kid with the stink eye I gave the ball.

title: More Lingering Soul Molly ideas.
body:
After they bury Molly’s body and start to leave he suddenly appears to them as a ghost after failing to possess one of them, little dizzy, kinda confused. And everyone’s like “AAAH WTF” and ready to attack and Molly’s like

Molly missing his favorite foods, so someone lets him possess them and take control to see if he can taste something they eat. Spoilers: He cannot, he could only experience what his host sees and hears based on the class mechanics. Ghost angst.
On that note I think the whole party would be very into experimenting with the limits of Molly’s current form. 
Beau: Can you feel this? -jams her staff through him-
Molly: AAH! URGH! GAH!
Everyone screams
Molly: Nah I’m just fucking with you, I don’t feel anything.
Beau gets bored one day and starts throwing ball bearings through him. She and maybe Jester and/or Nott make a game of it. 

The 15th level Calling of the Spirit Guardian ability Guardian Transformation is really cool, the lingering soul can basically turn their host into a pseudo-ghost.

While this would be cool for anyone, it would be especially good for the more melee-centered characters.

summary: U know what? Matt could have taken an easy route and made that asshole spare Molly and take them all captives or something...
body: U know what? Matt could have taken an easy route and made that asshole spare Molly and take them all captives or something because he’s a slaver, I guess, but he decided to stay true to his villain’s character and do the most realistic and right in the narrative sense thing to do even if it means killing his friend’s character and the wrath of the Fandom. And that is some good dm-ing.

reblog.comment: U know what? summary: Sometimes playing true to your character gets you killed. Taliesin did that and Molly died. It was a fantastic set up for a...
body: Sometimes playing true to your character gets you killed. Taliesin did that and Molly died. It was a fantastic set up for a terrible villain and I am interested af to see how Matt and Taliesin deal with it.

summary: Is there a way to watch Critical role with the stats on screen? Or can someone help me out here. I see pictures of them with...
body:
Is there a way to watch Critical role with the stats on screen? Or can someone help me out here.
I see pictures of them with their like hit points and stuff and I’m super confused as to how Molly ended up at 0 when I only counted 49 lost hit points during the battle (and he should have 59) so I wanted to watch it back with the onscreen stats to see what I was missing.

But is that just a livestream thing?

summary: Okay, so I'm gonna be writing a bit of widomauk this week because I need to do something productive with my brain other than...
body:
Okay, so I’m gonna be writing a bit of widomauk this week because I need to do something productive with my brain other than wallow.

However, I’m putting Ex Nihilo on hold for the time being (until I know whether or not Molly’s current state is permanent) and I’m gonna start that modern fic I’ve mentioned before. Plenty of fluff and good times.
